Cás-staidéar: Do cháin ioncaim a ríomh
Case studies on how to calculate your tax in 2017
Cás-staidéir maidir le conas do cháin a ríomh in 2017
These examples show the different factors involved in calculating your tax in 2017
Léiríonn na samplaí seo na fachtóirí éagsúla a bhaineann le do cháin a ríomh in 2017
Joan is single and earns €28,000 a year
Is duine singil í Joan agus tuileann sí €28,000 sa bhliain
She receives her notice of determination of tax credits and standard rate cut-off point from Revenue
Faigheann sí fógra cinnidh a creidmheasanna cánach agus pointe scoite a ráta chaighdeánaigh ó na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
Joan’s tax credits are listed on the notice as:
Tá creidmheasanna cánach Joan liostaithe ar an bhfógra mar seo a leanas:
Single Person Tax Credit = €1,650
Creidmheas Cánach do Dhuine Singil = €1,650
Employee (PAYE) Tax Credit = €1,650
Creidmheas Cánach d’Fhostaí = €1,650
Tax credit total = €3,300
Líon iomlán na gCreidmheasanna cánach = €€3,300
The standard rate cut-off point for a single person is €33,800
Pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh do dhuine singil ná €33,800
Because Joan’s income is below the cut-off point, all of her income is taxed at the standard rate, (20%), to give her gross tax
Os rud é go bhfuil ioncam Joan faoin bpointe scoite, gearrtar cáin ar a cuid ioncaim go léir ag an ráta caighdeánach, (20%), chun a cáin chomhlán a fháil
28,000 x 20% = €5,600 cáin chomhlán
All her tax credits are deducted from the gross tax to give the tax that is payable:
Asbhaintear líon iomlán na gcreidmheasanna cánach ón gcáin chomhlán chun an méid cánach is iníoctha a thabhairt:
Joan is also liable to pay the Universal Social Charge (USC). Find out more about the Universal Social Charge
Tá dliteanas ar Joan an Muirear Uilíoch Sóisialach (MUS) dá hollioncam a íoc freisin

Is é an méid iomlán a bhaintear as a hioncam ná:
You can get the monthly or weekly amount of the total tax that should be deducted from wages by dividing this annual figure by 12 or by 52 respectively
Is féidir leat teacht ar mhéid míosúil nó seachtainiúil na cánach ba cheart a bhaint ó thuarastail tríd an bhfigiúr bliantúil seo a roinnt faoi 12 nó faoi 52 faoi seach
Tax rates and the standard rate cut-off point
Rátaí cánach agus pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh
A single taxpayer who earns €40,000 a year will have their tax calculated as follows:
Is mar seo a leanas a ríomhfar an cháin atá le híoc ag cáiníocóir singil a thuileann €40,000 sa bhliain:
The standard rate band for a single taxpayer is €33,800
An banda ráta caighdeánach do cháiníocóir singil ná €33,800
This means that the first €33,800 is taxed at the standard rate of tax, 20%, and the remainder (€6,200) is taxed at the higher rate of tax, 40%
Ciallaíonn sé sin go ngearrtar cáin ar an gcéad €33,800 ag an ráta caighdeánach, 20%, agus go ngearrtar cáin ar an bhfuílleach (€6,200) ag an ráta cánach níos airde, 40%
Tax credits are deducted from this amount to give the tax due
Asbhaintear creidmheasanna cánach ón méid sin chun an cháin atá dlite a thabhairt
